fields.description:
h2. Summary
The Bubble Chart gadget gives "Unknown error occurred rendering this gadget" in IE 11.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Bubble chart* gadget to the dashboard.
# Select the filer/project and click *Save*

h2. Expected Results
The gadget chart is rendered based on the filter.

h2. Actual Results
"Unknown error occurred rendering this gadget"

h2. Workaround
Use Firefox or Chrome browser.
fields.summary: Bubble Gadget will not render in MS IE 11 browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Invalid character can be inserted in the Project Name when creating a Project or by editing the Project name. If an invalid character is present, the JIRA External Import for CSV is broken because the Project List can't be generated.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project and paste the following: {code}Invalid character  here{code}
#* There is an invalid character right before the word "here". hex: e2 80 a8 [LINE SEPARATOR|http://www.utf8-chartable.de/unicode-utf8-table.plstart=8192&number=128]
# Go to "JIRA Administration"
# Click on "External System Import" and "CSV"
# Select a source file and click "Next"
# Select a project on the "Import to Project" combo box

*Expected Results*
The combo box should show the option to "Create New" and then list all compatible projects available for the user.

*Actual Results*
 * The combo box will only show "No Matches".
 * The following error appears in the browser Console.
{noformat}
Uncaught Error: AJS.Descriptor: expected property [label] but was undefined
{noformat}

h3. Find if JIRA site is affected:

The following search for non ASCII characters in the DB returns one or more projects:
{noformat}
select pname as Project from project where not pname ~ ( '^('||
 $$[\09\0A\0D\x20-\x7F]|$$||               -- ASCII
 $$[\09\0A\0D\xA1-\xFF]|$$||               -- ASCII ext
 ')*$' );
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Find the Project with the invalid character by running the DB query and rename it using the "Edit Project" option in the Project Administration section.
No reindex of downtime needed.
fields.summary: Project name not printable on JIRA External Import project combo box due to special characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We are seeing problems with new installations and connections for the JIRA apps for Slack and the integrations between JIRA Cloud and Trello and Confluence Cloud and Trello.

h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.892.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a integration between JIRA and Slack
# Add a JIRA to Slack and it won't render

h3. Expected Results
JIRA ticket is rendered on Slack

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
This JIRA Cloud instance does not appear to have the Slack integration available
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
* Customers should be able to manually install the Connect add-ons via UPM 
** by searching for Slack and installing "Slack for JIRA" by Atlassian
** by searching for Trello and installing "JIRA Trello Powerup (BETA)" by Atlassian or "Confluence Trello Powerup (BETA)" by Atlassian
* Once you've installed the connector in JIRA or Confluence, you should be able to follow the installation process from Trello or Slack as normal.
fields.summary: Problems with Slack and Trello integrations for JIRA Cloud

fields.description: Server Alerts had a lot of nice features including the JQL customization, but it was a bit more difficult to set up. Please add features such as either only including changes made by certain users or excluding certain users' changes from showing up.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

A user would like to be able to be notified of all the entries in *Audit Log*. For example, the user can keep track on who created a project or edited a workflow. 
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to allow administrator to get notified from Audit Log.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using date format "EEEE, MMMM dd, yyyy h:mm:ss a" is not working when import using CSV

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use CSV file that have date format "Wednesday, January 22 , 2014 4:25:41 PM"

# Import the CSV using "EEEE, MMMM dd, yyyy h:mm:ss a" date format

h3. Expected Results

Will be able to import the issue successfully

h3. Actual Results
Error return :-
{noformat}
Unable to parse created date: Wednesday, January 22 , 2014 4:25:41 PM{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Edit the CSV file to used "d/m/yyyy h:mm:ss a" date format
fields.summary: CSV Import using long Date Format is not working

Documentation about Advanced Search (DOES NOT CONTAIN: !~)

fields.description: It would be great if users could subscribe themselves to individual cards either with a custom slash command or even by simply selecting some kind of "command" that the JIRABot supplies when another user mentions a JIRA card in a channel.
fields.summary: Add individual card subscriptions for users

fields.description: Text type attachments should not open directly in the browser window.  Expected behavior would be a separate viewer as with image files so that one can preview the file and then click a button to download it.  Unified behavior makes it easier to anticipate what the controls will do.
fields.summary: Text type attachments should not open directly in browser

fields.description: When an issue has more than one attachment, it would be convenient if the user could download all attachments with a single action - a button, an option in the context menu, etc.
fields.summary: Option/button to download all attachments

fields.description: As per as this article from Atlassian [Link JIRA issues to confluence pages automatically|[https://www.atlassian.com/blog/confluence/link-jira-issues-to-confluence-pages-automatically]] that we are able to link automatically issues to confluence page, we'd appreciate if could have an easier way to link Confluence page to JIRA pages. Paste it on JIRA issue (may be in Edit mode) and it link the pages directly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a security issue in an issue and the user is not allowed to see it, the issue can still be assigned to him. This is an expected behavior since the security issues feature will affect only the visibility of the issue, however, the permission helper will display that the user isn't an assignable user.
h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA v1000.885.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce

  # Create a security level to an issue to restrict the access to a specific group

  # Assign the issue to a user which is not in this group

  # Go in the permission helper and fill the fields user, issue and permission as you applied.

 h3. Expected Result

The permission helper will display that the user is an assignable user.
h3. Actual Results

The permission helper will display: 

_Status: User does not have the 'Assignable User' permission_
|Issue Security|User is not in security level [level 1|https://pjuniordev.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditIssueSecurities!default.jspa?schemeId=10201]|
fields.summary: Permission helper not display correct information for assignable user

fields.description:

To be able to bulk move/copy users in a group.

Provide a feature to allow users to be able to bulk move/copy users to another group.
fields.summary: Able to bulk edit users in group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

To be able to bulk move/copy users in a group.
h3. Suggested Resolution

fields.summary: Able to bulk edit users in group

fields.description: In some cases it may help if a comment or note can be added in user management. This is expecially helpful when users are added for specific projects, for testing, etc. It can also help to register why a user was added to a specific group, when this group may not seem logical.
fields.summary: Notes in user management

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 November 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. We would love to learn more about how you use audit logs. We appreciate if you could please fill out our short survey [here.|https://goo.gl/forms/WP0XIu3bwGGEaK5g1]

Your feedback is key to helping us understand how we can continue improving your experience with our products. 

Thanks,
 Rak Garg
 Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}

At this moment the audit log shows all changes in user management with the author "JIRA". This makes it impossible to find out who added users or added them to a specific group. 

It should be possible to find out who created or changed a user. This can be either in the Audit log or on user details, or both.
fields.summary: Audit log for user management

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Imports that last more than 40 minutes fail and display the following error:
{quote}
There was an error importing file <filename.zip> "<json>". Please try again or choose a different file.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to JIRA Import
 # Click "Begin import" and select a big file

h3. Expected Results
JIRA successfully imports the provided archive.

h3. Actual Results
An error message is shown.


h3. Workaround

Split the imported file into smaller ZIP files and import them sequentially.
fields.summary: Cannot upload import file when the process exceeds 40 min

fields.description:
h3. Description

When creating/cloning a board or editing the filter of a board the drop down list for the filters will be empty and the following error message will be displayed
{code:java}
"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."{code}
h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Open a board in the JIRA
2. Open the board settings 
3. Click in the dropdown for Saved Filter
h3. Expected result

A list of all Filters available for the board will be displayed
h3. Actual result

The dropdown gets blank and the following error message will be displayed in a pop-up box:

"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
h3. Workaround

No workaround is available at this time.
fields.summary: Filter Selection Error When Creating or Cloning a Board or Configure a Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The documentation [Connect JIRA Cloud to Bitbucket Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/connect-jira-cloud-to-bitbucket-cloud-814188428.html#ConnectJIRACloudtoBitbucketCloud-continue] implies there is a possibility to integrate JIRA Core with Bitbucket. 

Instances which only have JIRA Core have no DVCS account link.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the JIRA Core integration with Bitbucket from the documentation
fields.summary: The documentation "Connect JIRA Cloud to Bitbucket Cloud" implies JIRA Core can be integrated with Bitbucket

fields.description: The ability to see the user's last login time is helpful. In certain situations, it is also useful to be able to view the historical information for this as well.
fields.summary: Audit Log for user logins

fields.description:
The UI design for the JIRA custom fields configure page can be prone to user error.

The Edit Scheme icon is very close to the Delete Scheme icon. It is easy for a user to accidentally click on the "Delete Scheme" icon unintentionally. Once clicked on, if the user tries to use the "back" button, all of the field options disappear.

 

Use case:
 * User accidentally clicks "Delete Scheme"
 * Behavior appears to be a long running "Spinning Icon" displayed.
 * User clicks refresh or back button.

Outcome:
 * The Custom Field looses all options/values from the field itself
 * Any issue that previously had a value has the value blanked out.

This request is to improve the UI by separating the "Edit Scheme" button from the "Delete Scheme" button. Also, there should be a "Deleting Scheme - Are you sure" dialog that would appear before deleting the values from the field. 

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Custom Field values need restore path

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JIRA's current visual configuration is not friendly for using vertical screens, i.e: when you open issue details while viewing a board, you have lots of unused space on the bottom and the issue details appear on the right, squished up because the screen is narrow. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Better use the vertical space, Javascript can detect user's monitor, if in a vertical one the issue detail could be shown at the bottom. As long as some other changes.

h3. Why this is important

Be more visually attractive and practical for who use vertical monitors (widely used for programming)
fields.summary: Improve vertical screen usage

fields.description: As an admin, I would like a way of tracking down where the email notifications are when they are not received.
fields.summary: Track down where the email notifications are when they are not received

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Media server is currently experiencing high latency making any actions related to attachments time out.

h3. Environment
* JIRA/Confluence Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to upload/download/view an attachment in JIRA/Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
The operation is successful.

h3. Actual Results
The operation fails because the media server is not available.

h3.Workaround
No workaround right now but Atlassian is aware of this issue and is currently working to resolve it ASAP.
*EDIT*: There is no ETA for the resolution of this incident at the moment. You can also check http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/ntr7qbtjg0bp which will be updated as well regularly.

*EDIT 2*: The incident has been resolved and you should be able to proceed with attachments operation progressively.
fields.summary: Media server is unavailable causing multiple issues with attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Based on [Advance use of the JIRA Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Advanced+use+of+the+JIRA+issue+collector] documentation, issue collector localization will followed the default JIRA localization. If customer have multiple of website with different language , they can't set the issue collector based on the website language.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide language option for admin to select when configuring issue collector. Each issue collector can have it's own specific language.

h3. Why this is important
Customer need this for their front end user (with different language).
fields.summary: Admin able to configure language from Issue Collector configuration

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Blank page is showing on the business board
 !Screen Shot 2017-04-05 at 9.15.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a business project
 # View the business board

h2. Version
JIRA v1000.883.0


h2. Expected

Business board is showing.

h2. Actual

Blank page on the business board

h2. Workaround

The issue only happens on Safari Version 9.1.2 which is not supported (10 or higher only). 
- Update Safari
- Use Google Chrome or Mozzila Firefox.
fields.summary: Unable to view business board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Modifying a workflow scheme tied to a large number of projects will create a zombie task and fail, and will then create multiple copies of the scheme and tie projects to them. The impact is that each time a change is made, more copies are created and the user has to reassociate all projects with the original scheme each time.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* This was tested on a scheme with 21 projects tied to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a workflow scheme change for a scheme tied to a large number of projects (~20)
# Publish the changes
# The task will create multiple copies of the scheme and tie random projects from the initial to each copy.

h3. Expected Results
The scheme changes should be saved and all projects should stay under the original scheme.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the jira log file and the copies are created, each containing some of the projects from the initial scheme:
{code}

2017-03-09 21:30:04.134452500 2017-03-09 21:30:04,133 Caesium-1-3 WARN sysadmin     [c.a.j.t.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.privacy-safe] While executing 121536 identified task to be in state COMPLETE in runner: ProgressAwareTaskService:com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunnerand killed it.
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134454500 com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ZombieException: While executing 121536 identified task to be in state COMPLETE
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134454500 	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressUpdateWriterImpl.checkCorrectTaskStateToUpdate(ProgressUpdateWriterImpl.java:75)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134469500 	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressUpdateWriterImpl.setProgressAsPercent(ProgressUpdateWriterImpl.java:46)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134469500 	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.PartialProgressUpdateWriter.setProgressAsPercent(PartialProgressUpdateWriter.java:23)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134470500 	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.PartialProgressUpdateWriter.setProgressAsPercent(PartialProgressUpdateWriter.java:23)

2017-03-09 21:30:04.134487500 	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.ProjectMigrator.migrate(ProjectMigrator.java:200)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134487500 	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.DraftWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper.migrate(DraftWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper.java:179)

2017-03-09 21:30:04.134492500 	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunner.migrate(WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunner.java:107)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134493500 	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunner.runTask(WorkflowSchemeMigrationTaskRunner.java:63)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134494500 	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.processMessage(ProgressAwareMessageRunner.java:87)
2017-03-09 21:30:04.134498500 	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.scheduler.SchedulerMessageRunnerService$AmqJobRunner.processNestedMessage(SchedulerMessageRunnerService.java:206)

h3. Notes
Likely tied to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65545

h3.Workaround

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
At the moment, even though JIRA issues are viewable by the public (browse project permission is granted to Group (Anyone)), Confluence-only users are not able to view those issues when logging in to Confluence. It is possible to view the public JIRA issues when the Confluence users log out from Confluence. 

It is not possible to view the issues as well even though the Browse Project permission is granted to confluence-users group since JIRA will be checking for application access and permission to view it.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability for Confluence-users group to view JIRA issues without checking for the application access when the Browse Project permission is granted to it.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to view JIRA issue to Confluence-only users

fields.summary: Make Jirabot terse please.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are appearing on boards of business projects with due date -1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a business project.
# Add issues with any due date.
# Go to the project board and check the due date.

h3. Expected Results
E.g: If the issue is created with the due date configured to be the next day it should show on the board as tomorrow "label".

h3. Actual Results
Issue is appearing with Today "label".

h3. Notes
Attached the following video showing the bug behavior, it's important to note that it corrects the "label" after clicking on the ticket.
[^duedateBug.mp4]
fields.summary: Issues are appearing in business board with due date -1.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA and Tempo are installed, each worklog deleted is causing a huge number of entries, this is can be checked within the database, and is timing out the following API call, as the call has a limitations of 1000 results, which are easily passed by when this happen.  

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/worklog-getIdsOfWorklogsDeletedSince

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Cloud instance with Tempo Timesheets add-on installed
* Tested with a user with access to many projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue, with worklog
# Add some worklog entries
# Delete some worklog entries
# Perform the call from [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/worklog-getIdsOfWorklogsDeletedSince]

h3. Expected Results
Properly have each logwork delete entry shown in the call

The call is returning 

h3. Actual Results
We're still not able to isolate the quantization like X calls to 100X calls. But with a few deletes you easily timeout the call by exceeding the 1000 deletes limitation

Snapshot before the worklog was deleted:
{code}
select ( p.pkey || '-' || j.issuenum ) as issue_key, c.newvalue, c.oldvalue, g.author, g.created from changeitem c, changegroup g, jiraissue j, project p where c.groupid = g.id and g.created >= '2017-03-10 00:00:00.000+00' and g.created <= '2017-03-20 00:00:00.000+00' and c.field = 'WorklogId' and c.newvalue is null and g.author = 'sysadmin' and j.project = p.id;
 issue_key | newvalue | oldvalue | author | created 
-----------+----------+----------+--------+---------
(0 rows)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Snapshot before the worklog was deleted:
{code}
 issue_key | newvalue | oldvalue | author | created 
-----------+----------+----------+--------+---------
(0 rows)
{code}

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{Applications}} menu redirects to {{Application access configuration}} if the only JIRA distribution in the instance is JIRA Core and JIRA Core Labs is not available

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.870.5
* JIRA Core only instances

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the cog icon
# Click on {{Applications}}

h3. Expected Results
{{Applications}} menu options are shown

h3. Actual Results
{{Application access configuration}} is open and so the options to {{Application Links}}, {{HipChat}} integration and {{Application Navigator}} aren't shown

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Go to <your instance name>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks
fields.summary: Applications menu redirects to Application access configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer faced this issue on his instance and we could reproduce this on a clone of his instance as well. 
See replication steps below :
To reproduce :
We edited the XXX Standard Workflow Scheme with say 20 projects
We expected the change to remain as is once we acknowledge the change
But the workflow scheme screen that appeared is titled "Copy 3 of XXX Standard Workflow Scheme " with 6 projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to View Workflow https://xxxx.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewWorkflowSchemes.jspa
# Click on the "XXXX" row of worflow scheme and click "edit"
# After completing steps - we expect the edit to reflect on the main workflow scheme but it shows "Copy of XXX" workflow screen instead when complete. It seems to split the workflow

h3. Expected Results
Workflow Scheme is editted and reflected correctly instead of creating a new workflow with a name "Copy of XXX"

h3. Actual Results
The final screen after workflow scheme edit shows "Copy of XXX" with say half the projects and original XXX workflow has some projects. Eg XXX originally has 10 projects then after edit XXX has 5 projects and "Copy of XXX" has 5 projects
 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Editing a Workflow named "XXX" splits and creates a new workflow name "Copy of XXX"
Add the ability to specify a project when using the "Epic Link" in (""). JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While configuring a new incoming email handler in JIRA, setting up with the create user function does not create a new ticket or a new user account.

h3. How to reproduce

# Add a mail server
# Configure the incoming email handler, mark the option to create new users, turn on the self-sign up on the user management.
# Send an email to the newly created email server.

h3. Expected Results

A new issue would be created and a new user account would be created with the new user been the reporter of the issue.

h3. Actual Results

None of the above got created.

h3. Workaround

Create the new users manually. Or, use a default reporter in the mail handler, so an internal user will create the issues on behalf of non-Jira users.
fields.summary: Incoming email handlers in JIRA can't create new users from the create user function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA shows "Project Documents" tab and template icons aren't linked properly.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud v1000.870.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open project on enabled instance

!Screenshot 2017-04-04 15.12.55.png|thumbnail! 

or

     1. Click 'Start a page' below links on a JIRA issue. 

!issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
 * Each templates is linked to page which belongs to space corresponding to JIRA project.

h3. Actual Results
 * It is linked to Confluence top page in {{/wiki}}.

h3. Notes
 * JIRA document does not describe what is "Project Documents".
 * JIRA should show _"Project Documents"_ features only if Confluence Cloud is activated in the same instance. Otherwise it's possibly considered as annoying advertisement.

h3. Workaround
 * None
fields.summary: "Project Documents" doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
Here's the customer's comment:

https://menlolog.atlassian.net/browse/OTM-11152?filter=13631
becomes...
https://menlolog.atlassian.net/browse/OTM-11152"

I've tested this on SDog and another couple of OD instances and was able to reproduce each time.

fields.description:
It seems that there is an issue with this customer's server timezone settings (_-Duser.timezone=_) not being picked up that breaks the iCal export.

I've tested the same behavior in my own instance by changing the server time to Buenos Aires and was able to reproduce this behavior.
At first I thought it was a mismatch between the server time and JIRA time (also later I considered user time). So after testing all combinations, the stack trace was still there. I changed my instance server timezone to Asia/Calcutta and did the same. Still got the same stack trace.
I changed the CATALINA_OPTS file to include _-Duser.timezone=Asia/Calcutta_ and then I got the calendar to work.
I changed the server timezone back to Europe/Berlin but kept the CATALINA_OPTS. The calendar was still working.
I removed from the CATALINA_OPTS the _-Duser.timezone=Asia/Calcutta_. Still working.
I added the CATALINA_OPTS with _-Duser.timezone=America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires_ to the customer instance, restarted and now it is working.

My theory is that there is some issue with joda-time not being picked up for some specific timezones. Possibly because Buenos Aires (and Calutta) is not observing daylight savings.

In any case here's the current workaround:
{noformat}
cd /service/j2ee_jira/user_env
cp /service/j2ee_jira/env/CATALINA_OPTS .
vi CATALINA_OPTS
{noformat}
Add this to CATALINA_OPTS:
{noformat}
-Duser.timezone=America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires
{noformat}

Save and restart.

From hops, the server timezone setup:
{quote}
edit /etc/atlassian/config/area-100/945/CONFIG
which has TIMEZONE="Europe/Amsterdam"
but that's a vz file
(openvz)
after restart, the box has a different time, now Tue Jul 10 16:16:50 CEST 2012
{quote}
fields.summary: Server timezone settings (-Duser.timezone=) not being picked up on OnDemand breaks the iCal export

fields.description:
{panel:title=Standards Mode Requirement|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The issue described here was caused by the host site not being rendered in _"Standards Mode"_ in IE 9. 

For collectors to be rendered correctly the page hosting them must be displayed in _"Standards Mode"_ 

Further information on "Standards Mode" is available at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg699338%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández. 
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].
{panel}

When placing the issue collector and open from IE9 the following error message is observed:

{code}
Line: 329
Error: Object doesn't support property or method 'forEach'
{code}

And some field might not be visible from there:

!collector.png|thumbnail!

NOTE: It only happened to the latest release for OnDemand instance. For download version, please raise a support ticket to get assistance from our engineers to verify this issue.

*Additional Information*

This only affects IE9. Chrome, IE10 and Firefox are not affected.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Not Rendering All Fields Correctly for IE9

Autowatch Rules

fields.description:
When a user is added to the group with Issue Level Security permissions to Browse a project, the changes don't take place immediately in the issue navigator.
The issues become available immediately via direct URL but can't be searched.
Reindexing doesn't solve the problem.
Note: After an hour (or sometimes more than 24hs) the issues become available on the issue navigator. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a project and a test user.
# Create an issue with the test user and verify that you can access the issue and see it listed with a Search of "project = mynewproject"
# Apply Issue Level Security to that project restricting it to a new group.
# Verify that now the Issue and the Search of that project is denied to the test user
# Add the user to the group

*Results:*
* Issue URL is accessible because you have permissions and belong to the issue security level group
* Search of the Project Issues return no results although you have the
permissions to browse them.

*Expected:*
* Issues are immediately listed doing a search for the project.


Images attached show:
* The test user 'mauro' has_permissions.jpeg (viewed using sysadmin session)
* test_user_can_see_issue_URL.jpeg
* search_return_empty.jpeg (project issues should be displayed immediately after adding the user to the required group)
fields.summary: Issue navigator doesn't show projects with Issue Level Security immediately

fields.description:
Saving an empty Balsamiq is throwing NPE

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to an issue and click Add/Edit UI Mockup.
2. Notice that on the mock up page, the SAVE button is disabled.
2. On the mockup page, add a mockup design component to it. SAVE button is enabled.
3. And then go to Edit -> Remove the added design component. SAVE button is still enabled.
4. Click SAVE and see the error message the corner. JIRA logs shows NPE.

Attached is the video of how to reproduce it and also the JIRA logs
fields.summary: Saving an empty Balsamiq is throwing NPE

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Insert an 'Average Time in Status' gadget onto a dashboard
# Set it up so that it interprets so much data that it will take over a minute to load
# Save the gadget

Result:

Gadget loads for a minute, and then throws you back to the gadget edit page

Expected Result:

Gadget eventually loads, or an error is thrown

fields.summary: NPE when pasting screenshot on the ticket

fields.description:
Since the latest JIRA UI update, the Comment button which used to be near the top of the issue screen has disappeared. I'm raising this as a BUG report due to the lost of functionality. Users are now having to scroll down to the bottom of what is often a long page in order to be able to add a comment. Previously we could to do that just by clicking on the comment button at the top of the page.

!example.png!
fields.summary: Add the comment button back on the top of the page

fields.description:
When I click multiple times on Save in the create issue type scheme I have duplicate issue types in my scheme.

I can easily remove the scheme and re-create it, just letting you know about the bug.
fields.summary: Duplicated issue types in issue type scheme on double submission in the create issue type scheme page

fields.description:
The actions drop-down menu within a user details is displaced using IE 8. (See attached pic.png)

And if the browser window is resized and then maximized, the Actions drop-down gets even more displaced.

Steps to reproduce:

* Login to JIRA using Internet Explorer 8
* Go to user's administration page.
* Enter an user's details page by clicking its username.
* Click Actions
fields.summary: Actions drop-down menu within an user details is displaced using IE 8

fields.description:
With the transition in JIRA 6 to user keys in lieu of user names, the pre-6.0 issue worklog is not being migrated correctly in the case of users who had LDAP-originating non-lowercase usernames. This results in the worklog entries not being associated with the user.

For example, in the database in JIRA 5.x, the usernames are always stored in lowercase in the database in jiraissue.reporter and jiraissue.assignee. However, in the worklog.author column, the usernames are persisted in mixed case to match the LDAP user.

This works fine in JIRA 5.x because JIRA is performing a case-insensitive match against the username. However, JIRA 6 is once again performing a case-sensitive match, since it apparently assumes that the user keys have all  been normalized to lowercase (and so that there is no namespace conflict with the new "IDxxxxx" user keys).

Unfortunately, this assumption fails in the case of the worklog table, since the worklog.author names are still left in mixed case. This yields in a failure to resolve the username when viewing the worklog for those users: it displays just the username (user key) without the display name or the corresponding inline dialog.
fields.summary: Migrated pre-6.0 worklogs with mixed-case usernames are disassociated from authors

fields.description:
SimpleDateFormat for *k* and *K* in JIRA are not parse properly.

In JIRA issues, the time will be shown as below:
{quote}
Created: 31/Jan/13 k:45 

Updated: 04/Feb/13 k:54 

Resolved: 02/Feb/13 k:45 
{quote}

While hovering over the time, it will be shown correctly.
fields.summary: SimpleDateFormat for k and K in JIRA are not being parsed properly

fields.description:
Hello,

First, I love the new look and feel your team gave us in 6.0.  I can't imagine the tremendous amount of work everyone put in!

I wanted to play with the automatic look and feel of the site.  I used a custom skin in v5, but wanted to see what your tool would come up with.  I uploaded the first image (see attached: first.png).  Because of the transparent background, the system adjusted to your default, this looked great, so I wanted to keep it.  Because this is our test system, I need to get the second image (see attached: second.png) as the logo.  When I did this, the automatic look and feel kicked in and created a nice schema, but I liked the other one better.  So I clicked "Undo" and it didn't go back to the blue schema.

So steps to reproduce:
1. Go to Admin -> User Interface -> Look and Feel
2. Upload first.png.
3. Navigate to another part of the site.  I did this to make sure the schema actually did save.  
4. Go back to Admin -> User Interface -> Look and Feel.
5. Upload second.png
6. Click "Undo" next to "We've updated the color scheme to match your logo"

That should do it.  I couldn't get the first schema to stick.

Thanks again for ALL the hard work your team puts in.  It makes my job and my departments look great.

Steve
fields.summary: Automatic look and feel undo doesn't seem to work

fields.description:
Clicking Edit in the Twitter Gadget does nothing.

We have another ticket for this here but it's in the wrong project (AOD) and is two years old.  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-2552

I have a customer who says he was able to use this without problems as of March 22nd.
fields.summary: Edit in Twitter Gadget does not work

fields.description:
tl;dr:
Bug: Fix version is being displayed on the view issue page, even when it is not configured to be displayed on the page. This also confuses people who try to inline edit it.
Expected behaviour: when the fix version is configured to not be displayed on a page, it should not get displayed.

=====

If the FixVersion field is not present in the screen associated to the Edit Issue operation, it is not possible to edit the issue in the Inline Editing. 

This is expected behavior, however, if the field is not present on the screen, it shouldn't be displayed when viewing an issue, as it leads you to believe that is possible to edit the field. 

Steps to reproduce: 

- Create a project in JIRA 
- Remove the FixVersion from the Default Issue Screen (used in the edit issue operation) 
- Create an issue in JIRA 
- Try to edit any field, the pencil icon to edit it inline will be displayed for all the fields, except for the FixVersion field, which can be confusing. 

Expected behavior: FixVersion field not present when viewing the issue.
fields.summary: Problems editing FixVersion field

fields.description:
Function getChangeItemsForField (https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/com/atlassian/jira/issue/changehistory/ChangeHistoryManager.html#getChangeItemsForField(com.atlassian.jira.issue.Issue, java.lang.String))  doesn't return first status of issue which is issue in after it has been created.

Can be verified by corrected Script runner plugin script PreviousStatusCondition.groovy which can be found here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/245000/jira-workflow-go-back-to-previous-step
fields.summary: Function getChangeItemsForField doesn't return first status of issue which is issue in after it has been created

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. open issue collector form from instance where you're logged in
2. click 'not you' link
3. the info box will close, but field with name and email won't appear. When you submit feedback it will be submitted as detected user.

*Workaround*

Log out of the JIRA instance the issue collector is trying to create an issue at.
fields.summary: Cannot change automatically detected user by JIRA Issue Collector form

fields.description:
1. Use search for issue to generate a list of issues
2. Select one of the issues by clicking it's hyperlink - full edit.
3. Notice that "return to search" and up/down available in top right of screen
4. Attach a screen shot and click attach
5. Screen of issue selected refreshes and removes "return to search" and up/down arrows.
fields.summary: Return to search link disappears after adding screenshot to issue

fields.summary: Order is lost when JIRA gadget is added to confluence

fields.description:
If a user is deactivated, which means it belongs to no existing group in JIRA, it is still able to be set as an issue watcher if it has the Browser Project Permission.

Steps to replicate:

# deactivate an user.
# try to add it as watcher in any existing issue

Result:

User is listed as a possible watcher, but if you select them an error comes up saying that you can't add them as a watcher

Expected Result:

User should not be listed.
fields.summary: Deactivated user is allowed to be added as watcher in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
When using advanced search, the 'Syntax Help' link overlaps the suggestion if the suggestion is "big enough".
Check screenshot.
fields.summary: 'Syntax Help' link overlaps suggestions when advanced searching

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue type.
# Copy any existing workflow.
# Go to an existing workflow scheme and add the add the inactive workflow from Step 2.
# Associate the new issue type to the workflow above in Step 3, and publish the workflow scheme.
# Delete the issue type created in Step1.
# Check workflow list and there will be one active workflow without any associated scheme.

!broken_workflow.png|thumbnail!

h5.Workaround:

# Create a dummy issue type.
# Assign the issue type to the affected workflow in any workflow scheme, and publish it.
# Remove the association first and the issue type can be deleted now without leaving the workflow as active.
fields.summary: Workflow being left active if the associated issue type is deleted

fields.description:
h4. View Issue Page

For users with edit permission:

Steps to reproduce:
- spin up OnDemand release 155,
- log in with IE 8 as a user with 'edit issue' permission,
- add and remove an attachment or close an issue

You should receive the mixed content security warning as per the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Intermittent insecure content warning in IE 8 over HTTPS on delete attachment and close issue

fields.description:
It would seem that the text search in JIRA does not attempt to find a 'term' within other strings. For example, a text search for needle within "haystack needle haystack" will be successful but the same search on "haystackneedlehaystack" is not successful and does not find the needle when it should!

How to reproduce:
1. create an issue with a summary of haystackneedlehaystack
2. search for 'needle' (/issues/?jql=text%20~%20"needle")
3. Do not see the issue you created in step 1 in the results

What should happen:
1. create an issue with a summary of haystackneedlehaystack
2. search for 'needle' (/issues/?jql=text%20~%20"needle")
3. See the issue you created in step 1
fields.summary: JIRA text search should 'search' through all text

fields.description: Since the 174 AOD release (September 24), customers are receiving the error "USER does not exist" (where "USER" is the user's full name) when assigning issues to users and assigning leads to components when using IE8.
fields.summary: Unable to assign issues, set component leads in IE8

fields.description:
I try to add a status on the on-demand Jira instance, and it fails I get a 500 error page.

[https://fluidretail.atlassian.net]
Jira version 6.2-OD-03
Administration > Issue Attributes > Statuses > scroll to bottom > Add New Status

It doesn't seem to matter what data I put in that form. It also fails if I try to add a status from the workflow editor.
fields.summary: Adding Status Fails

fields.description:
The email subject is "Username Conflict Notification", which does not match what the email is about:
{quote}
There was an error granting default application access to the new user 'a2'

We were unable to grant the user access to the following application(s):

    JIRA

To edit application access settings, visit https://gsmith.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/user/ApplicationAccessConfig!default.jspa. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Email subject for failing to add new users to groups is incorrect

fields.description:
The *Email from* settings inside the General Configuration *Settings* menu refers to changing Outgoing emails (which is restricted in OnDemand) and also points to the Outgoing mail menu, which has restricted access (only sysadmin can access it). When a non sysadmin user clicks on it JIRA goes on a redirect loop. 

Just for reference, this is the link for the *Settings* menu I'm referring to:
https://example.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa
fields.summary: 'Email from' settings on the General Configuration Settings menu refers to a link restricted in OnDemand.

1. Issues > Search for Issues
2. Enable Detail View (keyboard shortcut toggle 't')
3. On the issues list, 'Order by: Images'

'Not able to sort by Thumbnail' error is shown
fields.summary: Ordering By 'Images' in Detail View Throws Error

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*

# Create a new issue collector
# Copy the HTML snippet that looks something like:
{noformat}
<script type="text/javascript" src="https://instance.atlassian.net/s/e44932f85f56a19a16247ff640cd8fee-T/en_US-85s30r/6325/93/1.4.11/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector.js?locale=en-US?collectorId=a4c74713"></script>
{noformat}
# Paste that into an HTML document
# View that page

*Result:*

The issue collector will not load.

*Workaround:*

Alter the above snippet to remove 'locale=en-US?' and paste the entry into an HTML page. It will then load.
fields.summary: Locale parameter in Issue Collector causes it to not render

fields.description: Create a new Issue Collector, choose the "Subtle" theme, and use the "Embed directly in the HTML of your website" code. The background of the box is a light grey, and the link is rendered as white. This occurs even in an otherwise-unstyled basic HTML page.
fields.summary: Issue Collector "Subtle" theme is rendering link text as white, making it almost impossible to read

fields.description:
As an administrator, it is not possible to perform add-on configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to the JIRA admin section
# Click on the Add-ons tab (https://domain.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace)

h3. Expected result

It will redirect the user to the actual configuration page with a sidebar listing configuration options.

h3. Actual result

It redirects to Atlassian Marketplace page, but with no sidebar. See comparison screenshots.
fields.summary: Administrators cannot access add-ons tab in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
Similar to the following reported issues, we have to manually flush our JIRA mail queue (radiumone.jira.com) since it never flushes on its own:

 * http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257306741
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7523
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25787

The problem was first noticed on 8/10 or 8/11.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio Mail Queue Requires Manual Flush

fields.description:
The password policy custom menu allows character variety settings:
* Upper
* Lower
* Numerical
* Special
and 
* Combination

The 'Minimum Special' value is mandatory, even when '4' character varieties have been set.  Combination is set as 'At least 3 types'.  Password includes Upper, Lower and Numerical.  Example attached.  Reproduced on multiple instances.
fields.summary: Password Policy 'Minimum Special' always required

fields.description:
We used to be able to add comments directly from the Activity Stream on the Dashboard without having to go into each ticket to add comments. This function is no longer there although both Atlassian OnDemand and Standalone documentations say it should be:
- [Adding the Activity Stream Gadget - JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Adding+the+Activity+Stream+Gadget]
- [Adding the Activity Stream Gadget - JIRA OD|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Adding+the+Activity+Stream+Gadget]

Even with all permissions enabled, you can no longer add comments.

*Current activity stream*

!current_activity_stream.png!

*Documentation activity stream*

!doc_activity_stream.png!
fields.summary: Unable to post comments directly from Activity Stream on Dashboard

fields.description:
The arrows to move sub-tasks up and down within an issue are no longer visible.

!no_arrows.png!

If you click where those red circles are it will move the issue up and down. Further, if you hover over the circles it will show a 'Move Up' or 'Move Down' alt text.

To replicate

# Create a test issue
# Within the above test issue create two sub-tasks
# Go back to the original test issue
# Hover around the circles drawn on the image above and eventually your cursor will indicate that there is something that is clickable. This is where the arrows should be.
fields.summary: Move up and move down arrows for sub-tasks not visible

fields.description:
The field length on the move issue screen was decreased so that is unreadable for projects with long names.

For instance, if I have projects called *'Atlassian Support Test for JIRA'* and *'Atlassian Support Test for Confluence'*, I can't know which project I'm moving the issue to (see image below):

!move-issue-field-length.png!
fields.summary: Field length on the move issue screen was decreased
